video_title: Using Topical Caffeine to Slow or Halt Hair Loss | Dr. Andrew Huberman
transcript:
We all think of caffeine
as a stimulant that we drink.
I certainly drink coffee and yerba mate,
the occasional energy
drink, things of that sort.
Caffeine does many things
besides stimulate our central
nervous system and make
us feel less sleepy.
However, one of the things
that caffeine does is
it is a fairly potent
PDE inhibitor.
By being a potent PDE inhibitor,
it indirectly stimulates IGF-1.
Why? Well, because PDE
can suppress IGF-1
and by ingesting caffeine
or by applying topical caffeine ointment
or cream to the scalp,
you can suppress PDE sufficiently enough
to increase IGF-1 and
increase some hair growth
or at least maintain hair
growth in that region.
Now, this may come as a shock.

but head-to-head topical
caffeine application can be
as effective as minoxidil
application without actually
lowering things like blood pressure

And some of the other negative,
let's call them negative
because they are side
effects of minoxidil.
So caffeine ointments

various hair treatments

to become a more
prominent theme out there.

Most of the studies of caffeine
on the stem cell niches

clinical studies exploring this,

effects of minoxidil, cost
of minoxidil comparing
the efficacy of caffeine

caffeine as a topical treatment

to start exploring this pathway.
And there's no reason to
think that if you were
to try the caffeine ointment
and it didn't work for you,

because it doesn't carry all
the other kind of blood pressure
related effects and prolactinemia
effects that minoxidil does.
So if you look out there
into the hair maintenance
and hair replacement literature,
you look at the treatments

surprised to see caffeine there.
And also, don't be surprised
when I tell you what I'm about
to tell you now, which is no,

more caffeine in order
to accomplish the goal
of offsetting hair loss.
It is true that when you ingest
caffeine, it goes systemically.

adenosine receptors throughout

those adenosine receptors is
the main way in which caffeine
exerts its stimulatory
effects making you feel less sleepy.

Well, those adenosine

of the caffeine that you

ointments in a systematic way.

incidences of side effects,

essentially comparable efficacy
